Package generation

Interface Factory

All Known Implementing Classes:
MazeFactory
public interface Factory
Specifies functionality of a maze factory that produces a maze with a background thread. It applies the abstract factory pattern. This class is the factory interface and MazeConfiguration is the product interface. The asynchronous production implies that there is time between acceptance of an order (which returns immediately) and the actual delivery of a product. The order specifies what exactly is wanted plus a method to provide update on progress and for delivery of the product. The observer pattern is used such that the factory can notify the ordering class about progress being made or about product delivery.
Author:
Peter Kemper

  • Method Details

    • order

      boolean order​(Order order)
      Takes or rejects an order. The method returns immediately and signals if the order is accepted or not. The actual production is performed in a background thread and delivery of the ordered MazeConfiguration takes place by calling the deliver method of the given order object.
      Parameters:
      order - specifies what kind of maze is wanted and the result once delivered
      Returns:
      true if order is accepted, false if refused

    • cancel

      void cancel()
      Cancels the current order if there is any that is not not completed yet.

    • waitTillDelivered

      void waitTillDelivered()
      Wait till order is fulfilled. This method returns after the produced maze has been delivered. This method can be used to have a more synchronous behavior which is helpful for testing for example.
